gw.api.importing

Class XmlExporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.importing.XmlExporter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChecksumXmlExporter, XmlExporterXmlElement, XmlExporterXmlWriter

    public abstract class XmlExporter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles determining what to export. Sub classes can override what is that gets exported and definitely need to override how to actually export the the data.

      • addReference

        public boolean addReference(KeyableBean bean,
                            Key key)
        This indicates whether to add this reference to the bean being processed or defer that decision till later. Note that if this returns true that bean will be fetched and added to the beans being processed.
        Parameters:
        bean - the bean being processed
        key - the key being referenced
        Returns:
        whether this is the first time this key has been seen Implementation note: This is meant to be overridden, but there is a default implementation, see exportDeep, for an example of how this is used.

      • checkReferenceKey

        protected void checkReferenceKey(Key key,
                                 ILinkPropertyInfo linkProperty)
        This permits the caller to check the referenced items before they are created.
        Parameters:
        key - of the referenced element
        linkProperty - that relates to the referenced element

      • getOrCreateId

        protected java.lang.String getOrCreateId(Key key)

      • getProperties

        public java.util.Set<IEntityPropertyInfo> getProperties(KeyableBean bean)
        This will return the set of properties to be written out for this bean. It can be overriden if there is some other logic desired. For example, only export exportable fields. Note that fields are exported only if they have values.
        Parameters:
        bean - the bean being process
        Returns:
        the set of proerties to export.

      • finishExport

        public void finishExport(Bundle safeBundle)
        This will finish the export. 1. Ensure that all beans are processed 2. Create reference elements for any missing references Note this means those beans will be fetched 3. Check for errors
        Parameters:
        safeBundle - a bundle to get referenced beans with
